Resources For Composers: Violin Pedagogy

July 30 2022 music pedagogy, violin, musictheory

I'm writing a string quartet and have been reviewing violin technique. I though it would be helpful to compile a list of the classics of violin pedagogy: method books, treatises, exercises and so forth. Here's the list, which I will continue to update. I'll link to IMSLP files when they're available. Please let me know if I've missed anything you consider essential.

Auer, Leopold (1845-1930)

  • Violin Playing As I Teach It (1920)
  • My Long Life In Music (1923)
  • Violin Master Works And Their Interpretation (1925)

Bang, Maia (1877-1940)

  • Violin Method

Casorti, August (1830-1867)

  • Techniques of Bowing, Op. 50 (1880)
  • Étude du Sautillé No. 2, Op. 60
  • Exercises in Double-Stops, Op. 61 (1896)

Flesch, Carl (1873-1944)

  • Urstudien (1911)
  • The Art of Violin Playing (1923)
  • The Scale System (1926)

Galamian, Ivan (1903-1981)

  • Principles of Violin Playing and Teaching (1962)
  • Contemporary Violin Technique (1962)

Hřímalý, Jan (1844-1915)

  • Scale-Studies for Violin

Kreutzer, Rodolphe (1766-1831)

  • Études ou Caprices (1805)

Paganini, Niccolò (1782-1840)

  • 24 Caprices for Solo Violin, Op. 1

Schradieck, Henry (1846-1918)

  • Scale-Studies for the Violin
  • School of Violin Technics (1899)
  • Guide to the Study of Chords

Ševčík, Otakar (1852-1934)

  • School of Violin Technique, Op. 1 (1881)
  • School of Bowing Technique, Op. 2 (1894)
  • Violin School for Beginners, Op. 6
  • Changes of Position and Preparatory Scale Studies, Op. 8 (1895)
  • Preparatory Exercises in Double-Stopping, Op. 9
  • School of Intonation on a Harmonic Basis for Violin, Op. 11
  • School of Interpretation for the Violin, Op. 16

Spohr, Louis (1784-1859)

  • Violin School (1832)
